content: The Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Expansion Act of 1996, also known as the Act, repeals the sunset provision in the Veterans Health Care Act of 1992 and introduces cost recovery measures by allowing billing of health-plan contracts. The Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Expansion Act of 1996 repeals the sunset provision in the Veterans Health Care Act of 1992 and introduces cost recovery measures by allowing billing of health-plan contracts. This includes the right of the United States to recover charges for care or services provided to primary beneficiaries from their health-plan contracts. Section 8151 of title 38, United States Code, is repealed and sections 8152 to 8158 are redesignated. Section 8152 is amended to revise authority for sharing agreements related to health-care resources and medical schools, including adjustments to payment procedures and flexibility in negotiations. The Secretary may authorize services for non-veterans under certain conditions to maintain or improve care quality at a facility. Cross-references in title 38 are amended accordingly. Section 8156 and 8157 of title 38 are amended to update cross-references, replacing specific sections with new ones for clarity and accuracy. SEC. 4. PERSONNEL FURNISHING SHARED RESOURCES. Section 712(b)(2) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to specify the number of positions in the Department held by individuals providing health-care resources under certain sections.
